responses: Hello! How can I help you today?

Water potability is the measure of water quality and safety.It is calculated based on various parameters such as pH hardness 
turbidity and chlorine levels in the water.
Water parameters include pH hardness turbidity chlorine etc.These parameters are measured using specific methods and instruments to determine the quality of water.

The pH of water is a measure of its acidity or alkalinity.It is calculated on a scale from 0 to 14 with a pH of 7 being considered neutral. Water with a pH below 7 is acidic while water with a pH above 7 is alkaline."

hardness|water hardness|calcium carbonate,Water hardness is the concentration of calcium carbonate in water.It is calculated based on the levels of calcium and magnesium ions in the water usually expressed in milligrams per liter (mg/L) or parts per million (ppm)."

Water turbidity is the measure of cloudiness or haziness in water caused by suspended particles.It is typically measured using a turbidity meter which calculates the amount of light scattered by the particles in the water.

Chlorine is often added to water as a disinfectant to kill harmful microorganisms.The chlorine level in water is usually measured in parts per million (ppm) or milligrams per liter (mg/L) to ensure that it is within the safe range for human consumption.
